author: Evan Bartlett
title: Jose Mourinho says ‘sharp’, ‘intelligent’ Marcus Rashford needs just one thing to improve his game
text:
Rashford has not scored in the Premier League since September (Picture: Getty Images) Marcus Rashford ‘s struggles in front of goal for Manchester United continued on Sunday afternoon.
The youngster, while looking very threatening with his pace and mazy runs, missed two glorious opportunities from short range, instead finding the palms of Victor Valdes in the Middlesbrough goal.
The 19-year-old, who took the place of the suspended Zlatan Ibrahimovic, has not scored in the league since September but did receive a boost from his manager after the game.
Neymar drops transfer bombshell when naming the FOUR Premier League clubs he admires ‘Marcus is a completely different player than Zlatan,’ Jose Mourinho said.
‘We have to adapt to his qualities. It’s really difficult for him to score a goal [at the moment], but his movement is top class, second to no-one.’
Rashford burst into the team under Louis van Gaal last season but has struggled to replicate his form under Mourinho (Picture: Getty Images) The Portuguese manager hinted that all Rashford needed to do was score one goal and the floodgates would open.
‘[He was] so intelligent, so sharp, the first touch to put the ball in the best position to attack the space. For me, he played phenomenal.

‘Goals will arrive, no problem at all.’
Rashford, who has been called up to the England squad to face Germany and Lithuania this week, will have at least one more chance to stake his claim on a first-team place after the international break.

The youngster will be hoping his manager’s words come to pass.
